item.description:
THIS EVENT IS HAPPENING IN MANCHESTER  address to be annouced to rsvps

We will be getting together at a members house to learn the ways of Authentic Indian Cuisine. This will be a limited engagement. Our host has graciously offered to cook and to show anyone who's interested , how to do it themselves.. and promises to get everyone "involved" in the cooking process.

 

Neha will begin cooking at 5. Anyone who is interested in really watching learning can come at that point. Everyone else is encouraged to arrive closer to 7pm when the cooking will be done.

Here's the menu:

Appetizer:

Samosa: this consists of a fried triangular pastry shell with a savory filling, which includes spiced potatoes, onions, peas, and coriander. This will be served with green and brown chutney

 

Entrée:

Channa Bhatura: it's a mouth watering dish. Chole Bhatura is a fried puffy bread made out of All purpose flour.  It’s usually served along with channa masala, a spicy and tangy chickpea dish.

 

Vegetable Biryani: is a rich and exotic rice dish with spicy vegetables. The saffron aroma makes this dish very inviting. Biryani is a popular Mughali dish that has been adapted by Indians. Vegetable Biryani makes a great dish for a formal dinner or can be served as main meal.

 

Dessert:

Payasam: is a rice pudding, which is a traditional South Asian sweet dish. It is made by boiling rice or broken wheat with milk and sugar, and flavored with cardamom, raisins, saffron, cashew nuts, pistachios or almonds

 

Depending on the number of people RSVPing I can increase the number of  dishes. Do let me know if you are allergic to anything.

 

And yes, its going to be a BYOB event.
item.name: Enjoy Home Cooked Authentic Indian Cuisine
